channel.title: Pointers to Structs :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: You can declare a pointer to a struct just like you declare a pointer to another element type. The format for declaring a pointer is: type* name;So, to declare a pointer to a struct person element, we could say: struct person* personPtr;Suppose we have another struct person variable: struct person p1; strcpy(p1.name, "Jill"); p1.age = 18;Then we can make personPtr point to p1: personPtr = &p1;Allocating Memory We can also create struct variables by:
